title: circlesplot
text: cp_max parameter integer least 1. specifies many circles planets row. cp_max=3L 8 planets result plot circles arranged like: cp_max=4L 8 planets result plot circles arranged like: NOTE: cp_max parameter optional. leave blank, set default number circles row 10.
code: A B C D E F G H A B C D E F G H

title: circlesplot
text: Now want add color. can done via cp_color parameter. specify colors like : want use special color scheme like viridis, include package set parameter cp_color: NOTE: Every circle color. color-vector length vectors diameter planets. NOTE: cp_color parameter optional. leave blank, set colors white (#FFFFFF).
code: colors = c('#D1BBD7', '#AE76A3', '#882E72', '#1965B0', '#5289C7', '#7BAFDE', '#4EB265', '#90C987') circlesplot(cp_vals=diameter, cp_text=planets, cp_max=4L, cp_color=colors) library(viridis) circlesplot(cp_vals=diameter, cp_text=planets, cp_max=4L, cp_color=viridis(8))

title: circlesplot
text: title can set via cp_title. increase size title, use cp_title_size, e.g.: NOTE: parameters optional. leave blank, cp_title left blank cp_title_size set 1.5.
code: circlesplot(cp_vals=diameter, cp_text=planets, cp_max=4L, cp_color=viridis(8), cp_title="Planets", cp_title_size=4)

title: circlesplot
text: can modify line width / thickness circles cp_line_width parameter: NOTE: cp_line_width parameter optional. leave blank, set 2L.
code: circlesplot(cp_vals=diameter, cp_text=planets, cp_max=4L, cp_color=viridis(8), cp_title="Planets", cp_title_size=2, cp_line_width=3L)

text: may observe output RStudio lacks quality, especially rounding circles. export png-file, stay like . recommendation export plot pdf-file better quality. ATTENTION: may see something unexpected RStudio: create plot displayed lower right window (plots tab), seems like part plot cut happens due size lower right window. Either resize use following r code save plot pdf:
code: pdf("path/to/your/pdf/plot1.pdf") circlesplot(cp_vals=diameter, cp_text=planets, cp_max=4L, cp_color=viridis(8), cp_title="Planets") dev.off()
